The service  and decor  was nice.  Price was affordable but the food was kind of disappointing.  The sunomono needed more vinegar  (su means vinegar in japanese) tasted too much of sesame oil and salt. The pork in the ramen was good but the noodles texture  not traditional and tasted like it wasn't  cooked enough, the soup was lacking  umami...  dumplings tasted store  bought.  It's an interpretation of japanese ramen but not the real thing.
